title: Foxconn has discussed making bid for Nissan | Company Business News - Mint
summary:
Foxconn Explores Acquisition of Nissan to Boost EV Business

Date: Not specified   Source: Live Mint

Taiwanese manufacturer Foxconn is in discussions to acquire Nissan as part of its strategy to expand into the electric vehicle market.

  • Foxconn aims to leverage Nissan's expertise in car hardware manufacturing and design.
  • Jun Seki, a former Nissan executive, is instrumental in the negotiations.
  • This initiative aligns with Foxconn's ambition to grow its electric vehicle operations.
"Foxconn has a particular interest in the Japanese automaker’s core assets."

The potential acquisition signifies Foxconn's serious commitment to breaking into the electric vehicle industry, utilizing Nissan's established capabilities.
newTitle: Foxconn Explores Acquisition of Nissan to Boost EV Business

summary:
Best 10 IPOs of 2024 by Listing Day Gains

Published on Dec 18, 2024, Source: CNBC TV18

This article highlights the top 10 IPOs of 2024 based on their listing day gains, showcasing significant performances and investor interest.

  • 1. Vibhor Steel Tubes: 195.53% gain, shares closed at ₹446.25, oversubscribed 320.05 times.
  • 2. BLS E-Services: 171.11% gain, shares closed at ₹366.00, oversubscribed 162.38 times.
  • 3. Bajaj Housing Finance: 135.71% gain, shares closed at ₹165.00, total subscription was ₹4,42,340.80 crore.
  • 4. KRN Heat Exchanger: 117.63% gain, shares closed at ₹478.79, oversubscribed 213.41 times.
  • 5. Unicommerce eSolutions: 94.52% gain, shares closed at ₹210.08, oversubscribed 168.35 times.
  • 6. MobiKwik: 90% gain, shares closed at nearly double the IPO price of ₹279.
  • 7. Premier Energies: 86.64% gain, shares closed at ₹839.90, oversubscribed 75.00 times.
  • 8. Le Travenues Technology: 78.19% gain, shares closed at ₹165.72, oversubscribed 98.10 times.
  • 9. JNK India: 67.36% gain, shares closed at ₹694.55, oversubscribed 28.46 times.
  • 10. P N Gadgil Jewellers: 65.27% gain, shares closed at ₹793.30, oversubscribed 59.41 times.
  • 11. DEE Development Engineers: 65.18% gain, shares closed at ₹335.32, oversubscribed 103.03 times.
newTitle: Best 10 IPOs of 2024 by Listing Day Gains

title: Bhavish Aggarwal's big announcement: OLA to offer 10-minute food deliveries through ONDC | Company Business News - Mint
summary:
OLA Introduces 10-Minute Food Delivery Service in Bengaluru

Published on: December 17, 2023 by CNBC TV-18

Ola has launched its new service, Ola Dash, which enables quick food delivery within 10 minutes in Bengaluru, as reported by CNBC TV-18.

  • The service utilizes the existing Ola application and covers restaurants within a 1-kilometer radius.
  • Ola Dash is seen as a response to the booming quick food delivery market, competing with services like Swiggy's Bolt and Blinkit.
  • The quick commerce landscape is evolving, with Zepto also planning similar offerings.
  • This service represents Ola's diversification strategy, which now includes electric bike taxi operations in Bengaluru.
“Ola Dash's business will be similar to Swiggy Bolt's 10-minute food delivery offering.”

This new venture aims to capture market share in the rapidly growing food service industry by offering quick, efficient deliveries.
newTitle: OLA Introduces 10-Minute Food Delivery Service in Bengaluru

title: International Gemmological Institute IPO allotment status check online; GMP today - ET Now
summary:
International Gemmological Institute IPO Allotment Status Check Online

Updated on December 18, 2024, by ET Now

The IGI IPO experienced significant demand, particularly from Qualified Institutional Buyers, with a total oversubscription of 33.79 times. The allotment of shares is set to be concluded today.

  • The subscription window for IGI IPO was open from December 13 to December 17, 2024.
  • Shares bid amounted to 1,978,625,565 against 5,856,0902 offered shares.
  • The IPO price band was set at Rs 397 to Rs 417 per share.
“The IGI IPO witnessed the maximum demand from Qualified Institutional Buyers (QIBs) who made bids for 1,46,17,02,830 shares.”

The IPO is expected to debut on the Bombay Stock Exchange and the National Stock Exchange on December 20, 2024.

title: Rs 30 Lakh Toyota Fortuner Has Arrived! - MotorOctane
summary:
Affordable 7-Seater Toyota Fortuner Unveiled

Date: [Date Not Provided] Source: MotorOctane

Toyota has officially previewed the Hilux Rangga, a new 7-seater SUV aimed at affordability. This model is expected to cater to the Indonesian market while providing an extended and muscular design with robust features.

  • The SUV is built on a low-cost IMV platform shared with the Hilux, Innova Crysta, and Fortuner.
  • Features include a spacious interior for 7 passengers, dual airbags, touchscreen infotainment, and rear AC vents.
  • Powertrain options comprise a 2.0-litre NA petrol and a 2.4-litre turbo diesel engine with manual and automatic gearbox options.
  • The introduction of this model indicates Toyota's efforts toward making its vehicles more accessible.
"The new Hilux Rangga SUV is currently targeted for the Indonesian market, and is unlikely to make its way to India."

The unveiling of this affordable SUV aims to broaden Toyota's reach in markets with price-sensitive consumers, highlighting their commitment to affordability while maintaining quality.

title: Mobikwik Share Price Live Updates: Stock hits 20% upper circuit after stellar listing; Should you hold or book profit? | Stock Market News - Mint
summary:
Mobikwik Shares Surge 20% on Stellar Market Debut

Date: 18 Dec, 2024 Source: LiveMint

The equity shares of One MobiKwik Systems Ltd experienced a remarkable debut on December 18, 2024, with shares closing at a 20% upper circuit.

  • Shares listed at ₹440 on NSE with a premium of 57.71%.
  • Closing price of ₹530.70 on BSE, an increase of nearly 90.22% from the issue price.
  • The IPO had garnered significant investor interest, being oversubscribed 125.69 times.
  • The IPO raised ₹572 crore for business expansion and technological investments.
  • Investors are advised to hold for the long term given the company's growth potential.
"Mobikwik is the largest wallet player in India with 23.11% market share of the PPI wallet gross transaction values." - Market Analyst

This stellar debut reflects strong demand and investor confidence, marking a notable moment for the fintech sector.
newTitle: Mobikwik Shares Surge 20% on Stellar Market Debut

title: Fed set to deliver 3rd rate cut and Honda Nissan merger - what’s moving markets - Investing.com
summary:
Fed Set to Deliver 3rd Rate Cut and Honda-Nissan Merger: What’s Moving Markets

Date: [Insert Date Here] | Source: Investing.com

The Federal Reserve is poised to implement its third consecutive interest rate cut, with US stock futures trending upwards, and automakers Honda and Nissan reportedly in merger discussions.

  • The Fed is expected to cut rates by 25 basis points during its final policy meeting of the year.
  • Investors are looking for insights from Chair Jerome Powell regarding future rate cuts.
  • Honda and Nissan are exploring a merger amid challenges in the electric vehicle sector.
  • Oil prices are fluctuating as traders await the Fed's decision and assess implications of new sanctions on Russia.
  • Recent data shows robust consumer spending, a key driver of economic growth.

This potential rate cut and corporate merger highlight significant movements in the financial markets and automotive industry, likely impacting investors and consumers alike.

title: Stock Market Live: Nifty, Sensex Remain Down As ICICI Bank, HDFC Bank Share Prices Drag - NDTV Profit
summary:
Stock Market Live: Nifty, Sensex Remain Down As ICICI Bank, HDFC Bank Share Prices Drag

Date: 18 Dec 2024, Source: NDTV Profit

On December 18, Indian stock markets showed a downward trend with the Nifty 50 and Sensex facing declines, largely attributed to falling share prices of ICICI Bank and HDFC Bank.

Key Points:

  • Traders are facing issues authorizing stock sales due to problems at CDSL.
  • VA Tech Wabag's share price has plummeted the most in four years.
  • The rupee has weakened to a record low of 84.95 against the US dollar.

The domestic currency depreciated by 5 paise during the day, nearing a critical 85 mark.

Market sentiment is cautious as investors await further developments from key global financial institutions.

title: Buy Coal India; target of Rs 560: Sharekhan - Moneycontrol
Vodafone Idea share price target cut by 50% - Know why - ET Now
summary:
Vodafone Idea Share Price Target Cut by 50%

Updated Dec 18, 2024 | Source: ET NOW

Leading brokerage firm Geojit Financial Services has cut the target for Vodafone Idea shares by more than 50%, maintaining a HOLD rating.

  • The revised target is set at Rs 8.6, down from Rs 17.
  • Recent tariff hikes have marginally increased Vodafone Idea's average revenue per user (ARPU).
  • The company's subscriber base is expected to grow with 4G and 5G expansion from Q4 FY2025 onwards.
  • Vodafone Idea plans to raise up to Rs 1,980 crore through preferential shares, with major investments from Vodafone Group entities.
  • Share prices have significantly decreased, with a 39% drop in the last 3 months and over 90% in the last 10 years.
“The announcement follows Vodafone Idea's Rs 18,000 crore fundraise through Follow-on Public Offer (FPO).”

The brokerage's target revision reflects considerations of Vodafone Idea's financial viability and growth prospects amid recent challenges.
newTitle: Vodafone Idea Share Price Target Cut by 50%

Top Buzzing Stocks of the Day: NMDC, Vishal Mega Mart, and More

title: ITC Hotels demerger record date ANNOUNCED - Check share ratio - ET Now
summary:
ITC Hotels Demerger Record Date ANNOUNCED - Check Share Ratio

Updated: December 18, 2024 | Source: ET Now News

ITC Limited has announced January 6, 2025, as the record date for the demerger of ITC Hotels. Shareholders of ITC will receive shares of ITC Hotels based on the specified share ratio.

Key Points:

  • The demerger record date is set for January 6, 2025.
  • ITC Hotels will issue one share for every 10 shares held in ITC.
  • The effective date of the demerger is January 1, 2025.
  • Shares of ITC Hotels will be listed separately on NSE and BSE following the demerger.
"The Company and ITC Hotels Limited (ITCHL) have mutually agreed to fix Monday, 6th January, 2025 as the Record Date for determining the shareholders of the Company..." - ITC Limited

This announcement marks a significant step in the restructuring of ITC Limited's investment in the hospitality sector, providing shareholders with defined share allocations in the newly formed entity.
newTitle: ITC Hotels Demerger Record Date Announced - Check Share Ratio

title: Sai Life Sciences shares jump 16% post listing. Should you buy, sell or hold? - The Economic Times
summary:
Sai Life Sciences shares jump 16% post listing. Should you buy, sell or hold?

Publication Date: Wednesday
Source: The Economic Times

Shares of Sai Life Sciences jumped 16% to Rs 764.4 on the BSE after their debut on the exchanges. The stock debuted at Rs 650 on the BSE, which is an 18% premium over the IPO price of Rs 549.

  • The stock has surged 39% from the issue price.
  • Experts recommend cautious profit booking but suggest holding for long-term investors.
  • The IPO had decent demand primarily from institutional investors.
  • Sai Life Sciences offers end-to-end services in drug discovery and manufacturing for pharmaceutical companies.
  • The global market for small molecule contract research is forecasted to reach $159 billion by 2028.
"While the company’s positive financial performance and rising profitability are encouraging, the limited direct benefits from the IPO proceeds may lead to cautious investor sentiment in the long term." - Shivani Nyati, Head of Wealth at Swastika Investmart

Investors should weigh the immediate gains against potential long-term stability and market volatility.
newTitle: Sai Life Sciences shares jump 16% post listing. Should you buy, sell or hold?

5 Upcoming 4X4 SUVs Launching In India In 2025-26 - GaadiWaadi.com
summary:
5 Upcoming 4X4 SUVs Launching In India In 2025-26

Publication Date: November 2023 | Source: Gaadi Waadi

With the rising popularity of SUVs in India, several manufacturers are gearing up to launch new 4X4 and AWD models in the near future. This article discusses five noteworthy upcoming SUVs set to enter the Indian market by 2025-26.

  • Volkswagen Tayron: Expected launch in 2025, will use Volkswagen's MQB EVO platform and will offer a range of powertrains including 4X4 configurations.
  • Toyota Fortuner Hybrid: Launching in 2025, equipped with a 2.8L diesel engine and a 48V mild-hybrid system that improves fuel efficiency by 5%.
  • New-Gen Renault Duster: Set to launch in late 2025, will likely continue to offer AWD options.
  • New Nissan SUV: Sharing components with the new Duster, expected to feature AWD capabilities.
  • Skoda Kodiaq: Expected in 2025, will be available with a 2.0L turbo petrol engine and 4WD as standard.

These upcoming models highlight the growing trend and competition in the SUV segment of the Indian automotive market, catering to the increasing demand for versatile and capable vehicles.
newTitle: 5 Upcoming 4X4 SUVs Launching In India In 2025-26

title: ‘It’s dumb to IPO this year’: Databricks CEO explains why he’s waiting to go public - TechCrunch
summary:
Databricks CEO Waiting Until 2025 for IPO Due to Market Conditions

Publication Date: December 17, 2024 | Source: TechCrunch

Databricks recently raised $10 billion and feels it's unwise to proceed with an IPO in 2024 due to market instability. CEO Ali Ghodsi states that the economic environment, influenced by interest rates and inflation, makes now an unsuitable time for going public.

  • Databricks closed one of the largest funding rounds ever, raising $10 billion.
  • Ghodsi claims it's unwise to pursue an IPO during an election year and cites market instability.
  • While Databricks considers going public in 2025, CEO highlights that it may also extend to 2026.
  • The company aims for liquidity for employees but prioritizes market conditions over urgency to IPO.
  • Ghodsi points out that current valuations in the AI sector are part of an 'AI bubble'.
“It’s dumb to IPO this year,” said Ghodsi. “You get billion-dollar valuations on these startups that have nothing – that’s a bubble.”

Databricks is focused on positioning itself for future growth rather than rushing into an IPO under current conditions.
newTitle: Databricks CEO Waiting Until 2025 for IPO Due to Market Conditions
